info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 1:30PM EDT until April 9 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio...
Scioto River Near Prospect affecting Marion and Delaware Counties.
Maumee River At Waterville affecting Wood and Lucas Counties.
Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County.
Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio...
Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Wayne and Holmes Counties.
Eagle Creek Above Findlay affecting Hancock County.
For the Black River...including Elyria...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Scioto River...including Prospect...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Killbuck Creek...including Killbuck...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Eagle Creek (Hancock)...including Findlay...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Eagle Creek (Trumbull)...including Phalanx Station...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Killbuck Creek near Killbuck.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to Wednesday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Private property on Water Street in the Village of Killbuck flooded. Several county and local roads impassable including State Route 60 south and County Road 621.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.9 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/cle.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO WEDNESDAY EVENING
